required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Non-interventional Study to Observe the Computed Tomographic Angiography Image Quality With Different Contrast Media Injection Protocols Under Different Computed Tomography Machines Parameters Setting
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of the Image Quality in Coronary or Craniocervical CT Angiography With Different Iodine Delivery Rates Using Low Tube Voltage (80 or 100 kV) Imaging in MDCT

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the image quality for different iodine delivery rates at different low voltage scanning protocols (80 or 100 kV ) under the modern advanced Multi-Detector Computed Tomography (MDCT) considering the body weight of patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the image quality of different acquisition protocols in patients weighing less than 90 kg using low voltage 80 or 100 kV with a lower Iodine Delivery Rate based on the body weight of the patient, who will undertake coronary or craniocervical CTA (Computed Tomography Angiography) in routine procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Contrast opacification of the target vascular segments, measured in Hounsfield Units (HU)
primary_outcome.description: Defined as the CT value which can be measured on the CTA images.

secondary_outcome.measure: Value of CNR (contrast-noise ratio) of the vascular segments
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated by the formula: CNR = [Averaged vascular segmental CT value - brain parenchyma (for carniocervical CTA) / perivascular tissues (for Coronary CTA (CCTA)) CT value] / image noise

secondary_outcome.measure: Value of SNR (signal-noise ratio) of the vascular segments
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated by the formula: SNR = Averaged vascular segmental CT value / image noise

secondary_outcome.measure: Score of visual assessment of the CTA image quality
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective visual assessment using a 4-point scale: Non-diagnostic Adequate Good Excellent

secondary_outcome.measure: Score of diagnostic confidence of the CTA images
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective assessment of diagnostic confidence in the delineation of pathologic findings using a 4-point scale: Insufficient Adequate Good Excellent

secondary_outcome.measure: Injected dosage (ml) of the contrast media (CM)
secondary_outcome.description: Can be read from the screen of the CT injector.

secondary_outcome.measure: Injection rate (ml/s) of the contrast media
secondary_outcome.description: Can be read from the screen of the CT injector.

secondary_outcome.measure: Value of the Idoine delivery rate (IDR) (unit: mg I/s)
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated by the formula: IDR (mg I/s) = CM concentration (mg I/ml) * CM injection rate (ml/s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Value of the volume CT dose index (CTDIvol) (unit: mGy)
secondary_outcome.description: A parameter of the radiation dose which can be automatically generated and recorded by the CT machine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Value of the dose length product (DLP) (unit: mGy*cm)
secondary_outcome.description: A parameter of the radiation dose which can be automatically generated and recorded by the CT machine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Value of the effective dose (organ dose) (unit: mSv)
secondary_outcome.description: The effective radiation dose which can be estimated by DLP multiplied by a specific conversion coefficient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate of the patients who underwent CCTA before and after the CM injection
secondary_outcome.description: It can be read from the screen of the ECG monitor of the CT machine

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of injection pain or discomfort of the patients (Yes/No)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by investigators by asking patients if they have injection pain or discomfort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events / adverse drug reactions
Severity of injection pain or discomfort of the patients
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by investigators by asking the patients of the severity (mild, moderate, severe) if present.

arm_group.description: Craniocervical CTA under below setting: injection rate of iopromide: 4 ml/s, concentration of iopromide = 300 mgI/ml, injection dose of iopromide: 0.8 ml/kg BW, tube voltage = 80 kvp
Craniocervical CTA under below setting: injection rate of iopromide: 3.2 ml/s, concentration of iopromide = 370 mgI/ml, injection dose of iopromide: 0.65 ml/kg BW, tube voltage = 80 kvp
Craniocervical CTA under below setting: injection rate of iopromide: 3.2 ml/s, concentration of iopromide = 300 mgI/ml, injection dose of iopromide: 0.8 ml/kg BW, tube voltage = 80 kvp
Craniocervical CTA under below setting: injection rate of iopromide: 4 ml/s, concentration of iopromide = 370 mgI/ml, injection dose of iopromide: 0.8 ml/kg BW, tube voltage = 100 kvp
Coronary CTA under below setting: injection rate of iopromide: 4 ml/s, concentration of iopromide = 300 mgI/ml, injection dose of iopromide: 0.8 ml/kg BW, tube voltage = 80 kvp
Coronary CTA under below setting: injection rate of iopromide: 3.2 ml/s, concentration of iopromide = 370 mgI/ml, injection dose of iopromide: 0.65 ml/kg BW, tube voltage = 80 kvp
Coronary CTA under below setting: injection rate of iopromide: 3.2 ml/s, concentration of iopromide = 300 mgI/ml, injection dose of iopromide: 0.8 ml/kg BW, tube voltage = 80 kvp
Coronary CTA under below setting: injection rate of iopromide: 4 ml/s, concentration of iopromide = 370 mgI/ml, injection dose of iopromide: 0.8 ml/kg BW, tube voltage = 100 kvp

intervention.description: 8 settings for CT Angiography as described in group description.

study_pop.textblock: Patients referred for CT Angiography for examination of the cerebral arteries (suspicion of cerebral artery stenosis or embolism, or suspected carotid pathology) or for examination of the coronary arteries receiving Ultravist at 80 or 100 kV can be enrolled in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients for whom the decision to initiate CTA will be made as per investigator's routine practice.
- Adult patients (age ≥18 years) with a weight ≤ 90 kg.
- Written Informed Consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of hypersensitivity to iodinated contrast agents.
- Known or suspected hyperthyroidism or pheochromocytoma.
- Atrial fibrillation or any other cardiac arrhythmia that would preclude reliable ECG gating; have severe congestive heart failure (New York Heart Classification IV).
- Pregnant or lactating women.
- Patients participating in another clinical study.
- Patients who underwent PCI (percutaneous coronary intervention) or CABG (coronary artery bypass grafting) before the index CTA.
